description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1v8sv","text":"This protocol describes a spore based method for assessing Diplodia sapinea pathogenicity in Scots pine seedlings (Pinus sylvestris), including inoculation, symptom evaluation, and reisolation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":59,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":115,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Diplodia sapinea,Diplodia tip blight,infection assay,Pinus sylvestris infection,pycnidiospores,Sphaeropsis sapinea
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"5uovk","text":"Oostlander AG, Brodde L, Bargen M von, Leiterholt M, Trautmann D, Enderle R et al. A reliable and simple method for the production of viable pycnidiospores of the Pine pathogen Diplodia sapinea and a spore-based infection assay on Scots Pine. Plant Dis 2023; 107(11):3370–7.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":177,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmgu7","text":"doi.org/10.1094/PDIS-01-23-0107-RE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"coo6c","text":"Adamson, Kalev/Laas, Marili/Blumenstein, Kathrin/Busskamp, Johanna/Langer, Gitta J./Klavina, Darta/Kaur, Anu/Maaten, Tiit/Mullett, Martin S./Müller, Michael M./Ondrušková, Emília/Padari, Allar/Pilt, Enn/Riit, Taavi/Solheim, Halvor/Soonvald, Liina/Tedersoo, Leho/Terhonen, Eeva/Drenkhan, Rein (2021). Highly clonal structure and abundance of one haplotype characterise the Diplodia sapinea populations in Europe and Western Asia. Journal of fungi (Basel, Switzerland)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":372,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55jg6","text":" https://doi.org/10.3390/jof7080634.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"hct","text":"Use 2 year old container seedlings of Scots pine (Pinus sylvestris).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3uifl","text":"Ensure seedlings have no visible symptoms and have undergone two annual cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c473","text":"Apply the last fungicide treatment 8 weeks before the first inoculation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dt56l","text":"Replant seedlings in plastic pots filled with potting soil","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ag510","text":"Maintain plants at 20–25°C, 16 h of light per day, and high humidity (\u003e90% RH) for 4 d after inoculation, then switch to moderate humidity (60% RH).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cst6v","text":"Grow Diplodia sapinea on VMM (Vogels Minimal Medium) for 21 d at approximately 27°C under constant light (5000–6500 lx) to induce sporulation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":5,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9aai8","text":"Dilute the spore suspension to 2x106 spores/ml for inoculation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"10r1b","text":"Assess spore viability by spreading 600 µl of the spore suspension onto three VMM plates. Incubate for 7 h at 27°C and record the germination status of 200 spores per plate. Aim for an average germination rate of 88%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ebm1","text":"Confirm the absence of hyphal fragments microscopically.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kgnj","text":"Harvest the spores from the plate by adding approximately 2 ml of 0.01% (v/v) Tween to the plate and rinse the surface of the colony several times by pipetting. Repeat the procedure for a higher yield.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7aabc","text":"Wounded or not wounded plants can be inoculated. Wounding is likely to influence symptom development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bbud","text":"Wounding: Use a sterile scalpel to make a 5 mm long cut down to the cambium on dormant seedlings and on the last year’s growth segments of actively growing seedlings. Be careful that the cut does not become too deep.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2a1df","text":"Inoculation with Spores:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lqdi","text":"Pipetting: Apply 2 µl of spore suspension (approx. 4000 spores) directly onto the wound or unwounded stem.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7hsuj","text":"Spraying: Spray approximately 360 µl (approx. 720,000 spores) from a distance of 10 cm onto the wound or unwounded stem.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"u5it","text":"Control Treatments: Use sterile 0.01% Tween 20 for mock inoculation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18vli","text":"Evaluate the symptoms 4- and 6-weeks post-inoculation based on the classification into previously determined symptom classes, for example: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8843l","text":"1. No symptoms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93oe4","text":"2. Necrotic needles, no symptoms on stem","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vmvc","text":"3. Upper third of shoot necrotic","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fq2l","text":"4. Upper two thirds necrotic","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqifh","text":"5. Seedling dead","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cfcl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5h0pq","text":"After 6 weeks, cut off and discard the shoot tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94jv2","text":"Remove an approx. 1.5 cm long piece of the stem above the wound (if applicable), remove needles, and use for reisolation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8e8mr","text":"Sterilize stem pieces: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eo05j","text":" Immerse in 3% NaOCl for 60 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e4gjb","text":"Rinse twice in sterile water for 30 s each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"48kk7","text":"Dry on sterile filter paper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28aj4","text":"Cut four approx. 2 mm long pieces from the center of the stem samples and place on MYP agar. Incubate for 27 d at room temperature and ambient daylight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cm6d7","text":"Sort isolates into morphological groups from day 4 of cultivation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29oai","text":"Extract fungal DNA of a representational number of isolates for molecular identification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnpc4","text":"Use species-specific primers to identify D. sapinea (for example as described in Adamson et al. 2021).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"208uh","text":"Immerse in 70% ethanol for 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Spore based infection assay on Pinus sylvestris seedlings with Diplodia sapinea
title_html: Spore based infection assay on Pinus sylvestris seedlings with Diplodia sapinea
